title: Birds in Landscape, one of a pair
marks:
Signature and Inscription

LC: [Jitekisai]
LC:  LC: [Jitekisai]
text:
These paintings of herons, mandarin ducks, pheasants, sparrows, and magpies were originally mounted as sliding wall panels (fusuma). Naonobu served as the official painter for the shogunate in Edo (Tokyo) and Kyoto.

(with 2013.29.13.1)
description: six-panel folding screen; snow covered bare tree and plants on L with five birds; snow covered branch coming down from top in panel 3 with large bird seated on branch; small flying bird in panel 6
creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
